title: Colombs Law
intro:
Coulomb's Law, an elegant and foundational principle in the realm of electromagnetism, invites us to delve into the profound forces that shape the behavior of charged particles. This law is a cornerstone of our understanding of electricity and magnetism, unveiling the intricate dance between electric charges and the invisible forces that bind and repel them.
At its heart, Coulomb's Law articulates how charged particles interact. It tells a tale of attraction and repulsion, where the magnitude of force is directly proportional to the product of the charges and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them. This law has far-reaching implications, from the behavior of electrons within atoms to the functioning of electric circuits and the dynamics of celestial bodies.
Our exploration of Coulomb's Law invites you to unravel the mysteries of these electric interactions. Through engaging simulations, visual representations, and hands-on experiments, we aim to make this fundamental principle tangible and accessible. Whether you're an aspiring physicist, a student on a quest for knowledge, or simply a curious mind eager to grasp the forces that shape our world, this journey promises to shed light on the captivating realm of electromagnetism.
goals: Relate the electrostatic force magnitude to the charges and the distance between them
Explain Newton's third law for electrostatic forces
Use measurements to determine Coulomb’s constant
Determine what makes a force attractive or repulsive
